page.title: 20GEOGRAPHICAL DESCRIPTION p2
page.content: { Continued from p19. The attractive 18th and 19th C. stone_built core of the commuter village of Bothwell (population c5500) is a designated Conservation Area, while part of the town of Blantyre (population c20,000) has recently been identified as an area of multiple deprivation requiring priority treatment from the various agencies of Strathclyde Regional Council. Throughout the study area change and environmental improvement are dominant themes despite the economic conditions. Blantyre for example has recently acquired a new health centre, a sports centre, a shopping complex, sheltered housing and by_pass. { }
